oai_dc:dc.dc:title: APPLICATIONS OF CONDUCTING POLYMERS AS SENSORS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SUKEERTHI, S
CONTRACTOR, AQ
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: polyaniline film
gas sensors
fabrication
devices
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This article provides an overview of the tremendous technological potential of conducting polymers as sensors. Their electroactivity coupled with the ability to be switched from an insulating to conducting state makes these polymers attractive for use as sensors.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: INDIAN JOURNAL OF CHEMISTRY SECTION A-INORGANIC BIO-INORGANIC PHYSICAL THEORETICAL & ANALYTICAL CHEMISTRY, 33(6), 565-571
